stem: The nurse is evaluating clients in an ophthalmology clinic. Match each disorder with its characteristic visual change.

columns.text: Blurry, 'cloudy' vision with glare issues; faded colors.
Loss of central vision ('Blind spot' in the middle).
Sudden flashes of light, floaters, and a 'curtain' closing over the field of vision.

rationale.correct: Vision disorders present with distinct 'geometry'. (r1) Cataracts involve lens clouding (Blurry). (r2) Glaucoma involves high pressure damaging peripheral nerves (Tunnel). (r3) Macular degeneration destroys the 'Macula' (Center). (r4) Detachment is a medical emergency with sudden physical changes (Curtain).
rationale.incorrect: Retinal detachment involves NO pain, only visual symptoms.
clinicalPearls: Instruct clients with retinal detachment to maintain strict head positioning as prescribed and avoid any activity that increases intraocular pressure (straining/lifting).

questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember: Glaucoma = 'G'oes to the edges (Peripheral). Macular = 'M'ore in the middle (Central).

mnemonic.title: V-I-S-I-O-N
mnemonic.expansion: C-ataracts (Cloudy), G-laucoma (G-one edges), M-acular (M-iddle gone), D-etachment (D-anger/Curtain).

reviewUnits.heading: Vision and Sensory Impairments
reviewUnits.body: Nurses monitor for IOP and provide safety education to prevent falls. Treatment ranges from eye drops (Glaucoma) to surgery (Cataracts/Detachment).
reviewUnits.source: American Academy of Ophthalmology: Patient Education
